New Records: Klaus Gjasula's goal to make it 2-2 was the latest equalising goal scored in UEFA European Championship history (excluding extra-time).
Klaus Gjasula became the first-ever substitute to score an own goal in a match at the UEFA European Championship.
Key Match Events: Qazim Laçi headed in Jasir Asani’s cross to put Albania into a 1-0 lead.
Klaus Gjasula inadvertently put through his own net to give Croatia a 2-1 lead.
Klaus Gjasula scored an equaliser in the 94th minute to secure a 2-2 draw for Albania.
Pre-Game Insights: Zlatko Dalic made three changes to Croatia's starting lineup, bringing in Ivan Perisic, Josip Juranovic, and Bruno Petkovic.
Post-Match Reflections: After the late equaliser, Croatia now have to beat Italy in their final game to stand any chance of qualifying for the knockout rounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Volksparkstadion in Hamburg, where Klaus Gjasula used to play for Hamburg.
Others: Albania's average age was 26 years and 158 days, making them the youngest team Croatia faced in Euro 2024.
